hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Compression Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When Bitcoin's 10-day Bollinger Band width (20,2) contracts below 0.15 (15% of price) during a NEUTRAL regime, and price subsequently closes above the upper band with volume exceeding its 20-day average by 50%, a sustained directional move in the breakout direction will occur over the next 5 days, yielding a risk-adjusted return > 1.5.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended periods of low volatility (compression) often precede significant directional moves. The NEUTRAL regime suggests indecision and coiled energy. A volume-confirmed breakout from this compression signals institutional or strong directional commitment, reducing false breakouts.

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5 days after entry OR price reaches 1.5x the BB width above entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Daily close re-entering the BB band (close < upper BB)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals result in a 'fakeout' where price closes back inside the band within 2 days, or the 5-day forward return does not significantly outperform a simple buy-and-hold during the same regime.
